description: Code against the Bitbucket API to automate simple tasks, embed Bitbucket data into your own site, build mobile or desktop apps

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: This method is called every time a Bitbucket webhook event occurs
steps: User RapidAPI webhook url as url in proper blocks
Exchange code for accessToken using getAccessToken block

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Get oAuth 2 access token

blocks.name: listHookEvents
blocks.description: Returns the webhook resource or subject types on which webhooks can be registered.

blocks.name: listHookEventsByType
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of all valid webhook events for the specified entity.

blocks.name: listRepositories
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of all public repositories.

blocks.name: listRepositoriesByUsername
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of all repositories owned by the specified account

args.name: role
args.info: Filters the result based on the authenticated user's role on each repository.

blocks.name: getSingleRepository
blocks.description: Returns the object describing this repository.

blocks.name: addRepository
blocks.description: Create new repository

blocks.name: updateRepository
blocks.description: Update existing repository

blocks.name: deleteRepository
blocks.description: Deletes existing repository

blocks.name: listBranchRestrictions
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of all branch restrictions on the repository.

blocks.name: addBranchRestrictions
blocks.description: Creates a new branch restriction rule for a repository.

args.name: kind
args.info: kind describes what will be restricted. Allowed values are: push, force, delete, and restrict_merges.

args.name: value
args.info: Value with kind-specific semantics: "require_approvals_to_merge" uses it to require a minimum number of approvals on a PR; "require_passing_builds_to_merge" uses it to require a minimum number of passing builds.

blocks.name: getSingleBranchRestriction
blocks.description: Returns a specific branch restriction rule.

blocks.name: updateBranchRestriction
blocks.description: Updates a specific branch restriction rule.

args.name: value
args.info: Value with kind-specific semantics: "require_approvals_to_merge" uses it to require a minimum number of approvals on a PR; "require_passing_builds_to_merge" uses it to require a minimum number of passing builds.

blocks.name: deleteBranchRestriction
blocks.description: Deletes a specific branch restriction rule.

blocks.name: approveCommit
blocks.description: Approve the specified commit as the authenticated user.

blocks.name: unapproveCommit
blocks.description: Redact the authenticated user's approval of the specified commit.

blocks.name: listCommitStatuses
blocks.description: Returns all statuses (e.g. build results) for a specific commit.

blocks.name: addCommitBuild
blocks.description: Creates a new build status against the specified commit.

args.name: url
args.info: A URL linking back to the vendor or build system, for providing more information about whatever process produced this status.

args.name: state
args.info: Provides some indication of the status of this commit

args.name: key
args.info: An identifier for the status that's unique to its type (current "build" is the only supported type) and the vendor, e.g. BB-DEPLOY

args.name: name
args.info: An identifier for the build itself, e.g. BB-DEPLOY-1

args.name: description
args.info: A description of the build (e.g. "Unit tests in Bamboo")

args.name: refname
args.info: The name of the ref that pointed to this commit at the time the status object was created. Note that this the ref may since have moved off of the commit.

blocks.name: getSingleCommitBuild
blocks.description: Returns the specified build status for a commit.

blocks.name: updateCommitBuild
blocks.description: Used to update the current status of a build status object on the specific commit.

args.name: url
args.info: A URL linking back to the vendor or build system, for providing more information about whatever process produced this status.

args.name: state
args.info: Provides some indication of the status of this commit

args.name: key
args.info: An identifier for the status that's unique to its type (current "build" is the only supported type) and the vendor, e.g. BB-DEPLOY

args.name: description
args.info: A description of the build (e.g. "Unit tests in Bamboo")

args.name: refname
args.info: The name of the ref that pointed to this commit at the time the status object was created. Note that this the ref may since have moved off of the commit.

blocks.name: getSingleCommit
blocks.description: Returns the specified commit.

blocks.name: listCommitComments
blocks.description: Returns the commit's comments.

blocks.name: getSingleCommitComment
blocks.description: Returns the specified commit comment.

blocks.name: listCommits
blocks.description: Returns the specified commit comment.

args.name: exclude
args.info: Returns all commits in the repo that are not on these branches

args.name: include
args.info: Returns all commits in the repo that are on these branches

blocks.name: listComponents
blocks.description: Returns the components that have been defined in the issue tracker.

blocks.name: getSingleComponent
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue tracker component object.

blocks.name: listDefaultReviewers
blocks.description: Returns the repository's default reviewers.

blocks.name: getSingleDefaultReviewer
blocks.description: Returns the repository's default reviewers.

blocks.name: addDefaultReviewer
blocks.description: Adds the repository's default reviewers.

blocks.name: deleteDefaultReviewer
blocks.description: Deletes the repository's default reviewers.

blocks.name: getSingleDiff
blocks.description: Produces a raw, git-style diff for either a single commit (diffed against its first parent), or a revspec of 2 commits (e.g. 3a8b42..9ff173 where the first commit represents the source and the second commit the destination).

args.name: context
args.info: Generate diffs with lines of context instead of the usual three

args.name: path
args.info: Limit the diff to a single file

blocks.name: listDownloads
blocks.description: Returns a list of download links associated with the repository.

blocks.name: addDownload
blocks.description: Upload new download artifacts.

blocks.name: getSingleDownload
blocks.description: Return a redirect to the contents of a download artifact.

blocks.name: deleteDownload
blocks.description: Deletes the specified download artifact from the repository.

blocks.name: listForks
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of all the forks of the specified repository.

blocks.name: listWebhooks
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of webhooks installed on this repository.

blocks.name: addWebhook
blocks.description: Creates a new webhook on the specified repository.

args.name: events
args.info: The events this webhook is subscribed to.

args.name: url
args.info: The URL events get delivered to.

args.name: description
args.info: A user-defined description of the webhook.

blocks.name: getSingleWebhook
blocks.description: Returns the webhook with the specified id installed on the specified repository.

blocks.name: updateWebhook
blocks.description: Updates the specified webhook subscription.

args.name: events
args.info: The events this webhook is subscribed to.

args.name: url
args.info: The URL events get delivered to.

args.name: active
args.info: The URL events get delivered to.

args.name: description
args.info: A user-defined description of the webhook.

blocks.name: deleteWebhook
blocks.description: Deletes the webhook with the specified id installed on the specified repository.

blocks.name: listIssues
blocks.description: Returns the issues in the issue tracker.

blocks.name: addIssues
blocks.description: Creates a new issue.

blocks.name: getSingleIssue
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue.

blocks.name: deleteSingleIssue
blocks.description: Deletes the specified issue.

blocks.name: listIssueAttachements
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue.

blocks.name: addIssueAttachement
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue.

blocks.name: getIssueSingleAttachement
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue attachment.

blocks.name: deleteIssueAttachement
blocks.description: Deletes the specified issue attachment.

blocks.name: listIssueComments
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue comments.

blocks.name: getIssueSingleComment
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue comment.

blocks.name: checkIssueVote
blocks.description: Check whether the authenticated user has voted for this issue.

blocks.name: addIssueVote
blocks.description: Vote for this issue.

blocks.name: deleteIssueVote
blocks.description: Retract your vote.

blocks.name: checkIssueWatching
blocks.description: Indicated whether or not the authenticated user is watching this issue.

blocks.name: watchIssue
blocks.description: Start watching this issue.

blocks.name: unwatchIssue
blocks.description: Stop watching this issue.

blocks.name: listMilestones
blocks.description: Returns the milestones that have been defined in the issue tracker.

blocks.name: getSingleMilestone
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue tracker milestone object.

blocks.name: getSinglePatch
blocks.description: Produces a raw patch for a single commit

blocks.name: getSinglePipeline
blocks.description: Retrieve a specified pipeline

blocks.name: getPipelineSingleStep
blocks.description: Retrieve a given step of a pipeline.

blocks.name: getPipelineStepLog
blocks.description: Retrieve the log file for a given step of a pipeline.

blocks.name: stopPipeline
blocks.description: Signal the stop of a pipeline and all of its steps that not have completed yet.

blocks.name: listPipelineConfig
blocks.description: Retrieve the repository pipelines configuration.

blocks.name: updatePipelineConfig
blocks.description: Enables the pipelines configuration for a repository.

blocks.name: updateBuildNumber
blocks.description: Retrieve the repository pipelines configuration.

blocks.name: getPipelineSingleSchedule
blocks.description: Retrieve a schedule by its UUID.

blocks.name: updatePipelineSchedule
blocks.description: Update a schedule.

args.name: cronPattern
args.info: The cron expression that the schedule applies.

blocks.name: deletePipelineSChedule
blocks.description: Delete a schedule by its UUID.

blocks.name: listPipelineScheduleExecutions
blocks.description: Retrieve the executions of a given schedule.

blocks.name: getRepositorySSHCredentials
blocks.description: Retrieve the repository SSH key pair excluding the SSH private key.

blocks.name: updateRepositorySSHCredentials
blocks.description: Update or create the repository SSH key pair excluding the SSH private key.

blocks.name: deleteRepositorySSHCredentials
blocks.description: Delete the repository SSH key pair

blocks.name: getRepositoryKnownHost
blocks.description: Retrieve a repository level known host.

args.name: knownHostId
args.info: The UUID of the known host to retrieve.

blocks.name: updateRepositoryKnownHost
blocks.description: Update a repository level known host.

args.name: knownHostId
args.info: The UUID of the known host to retrieve.

args.name: hostname
args.info: The hostname of the known host.

blocks.name: deleteRepositoryKnownHost
blocks.description: Delete a repository level known host.

args.name: knownHostId
args.info: The UUID of the known host to retrieve.

blocks.name: getRepositoryVariable
blocks.description: Retrieve a repository level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to retrieve.

blocks.name: updateRepositoryVariable
blocks.description: Update a repository level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to retrieve.

args.name: secured
args.info: If true, this variable will be treated as secured. The value will never be exposed in the logs or the REST API.

args.name: key
args.info: The unique name of the variable

blocks.name: deleteRepositoryVariable
blocks.description: Delete a repository level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to retrieve.

blocks.name: listPullrequests
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of all pull requests on the specified repository. By default only open pull requests are returned.

args.name: state
args.info: Only return pull requests that are in this state.

blocks.name: createPullrequest
blocks.description: Creates a new pull request.

blocks.name: listPullrequestsActivity
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of the pull request's activity log.

blocks.name: getSinglePullrequest
blocks.description: Returns the specified pull request.

blocks.name: updatePullrequest
blocks.description: Mutates the specified pull request.

blocks.name: getPullrequestActivity
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of the pull request's activity log.

blocks.name: approvePullrequest
blocks.description: Approve the specified pull request as the authenticated user.

blocks.name: unapprovePullrequest
blocks.description: Redact the authenticated user's approval of the specified pull request.

blocks.name: listPullrequestComments
blocks.description: Redact the authenticated user's approval of the specified pull request.

blocks.name: getPullrequestSingleComment
blocks.description: Returns a specific pull request comment.

blocks.name: listPullrequestCommits
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of the pull request's commits.

blocks.name: declinePullrequest
blocks.description: Declines the pull request.

blocks.name: getPullrequestDiff
blocks.description: Fetches pull request diff

blocks.name: mergePullrequest
blocks.description: Merges the pull request.

blocks.name: listPullrequestPatches
blocks.description: List pull request patches

blocks.name: listPullrequestStatuses
blocks.description: Returns all statuses (e.g. build results) for the given pull request.

blocks.name: listRefs
blocks.description: List repository refs

blocks.name: listBranches
blocks.description: List repository branches

blocks.name: getSingleBranch
blocks.description: Fetches signle repository branch

blocks.name: listTags
blocks.description: List repository tags

blocks.name: addTag
blocks.description: Add repository tag

args.name: target
args.info: JSON object with target of the tag

blocks.name: getSingleTag
blocks.description: Retrieves information about single tag

blocks.name: getSrc
blocks.description: This endpoint redirects the client to the directory listing of the root directory on the main branch.

args.name: path
args.info: Path to the directory or file , e.g node/path

blocks.name: uploadCommit
blocks.description: This endpoint is used to create new commits in the repository by uploading files.

args.name: author
args.info: The raw string to be used as the new commit's author. This string follows the format "Erik van Zijst evzijst@atlassian.com".

args.name: parents
args.info: List of SHA1s of the commits that should be the parents of the newly created commit.

args.name: branch
args.info: The name of the branch that the new commit should be created on.

blocks.name: listVersions
blocks.description: Returns the versions that have been defined in the issue tracker.

blocks.name: getSingleVersion
blocks.description: Returns the specified issue tracker version object.

blocks.name: listWatchers
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of all the watchers on the specified repository.

blocks.name: listSnippets
blocks.description: Returns all snippets. Like pull requests, repositories and teams, the full set of snippets is defined by what the current user has access to.

blocks.name: listTeams
blocks.description: Returns all the teams that the authenticated user is associated with.

blocks.name: getSingleProject
blocks.description: Retrieves single project

args.name: owner
args.info: The team which owns the project.

blocks.name: updateProject
blocks.description: Retrieves single project

args.name: owner
args.info: The team which owns the project.

blocks.name: deleteProject
blocks.description: Deletes single project

args.name: owner
args.info: The team which owns the project.

blocks.name: getTeamInfo
blocks.description: Gets the public information associated with a team.

blocks.name: getTeamFollowers
blocks.description: Returns the list of accounts that are following this team.

blocks.name: getTeamFollowing
blocks.description: Returns the list of accounts this team is following.

blocks.name: listTeamWebhooks
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of webhooks installed on this team.

blocks.name: addTeamWebhook
blocks.description: Install webhook on this team.

args.name: events
args.info: The events this webhook is subscribed to.

args.name: url
args.info: The URL events get delivered to.

args.name: description
args.info: A user-defined description of the webhook.

blocks.name: getTeamSingleWebhook
blocks.description: Returns the webhook with the specified id installed on the given team account.

blocks.name: updateTeamWebhook
blocks.description: Updates the webhook with the specified id installed on the given team account.

args.name: events
args.info: The events this webhook is subscribed to.

args.name: url
args.info: The URL events get delivered to.

args.name: description
args.info: A user-defined description of the webhook.

blocks.name: deleteTeamWebhook
blocks.description: Deletes the specified webhook subscription from the given team account.

blocks.name: listTeamMembers
blocks.description: All members of a team.

blocks.name: getTeamSingleVariable
blocks.description: Retrieve a team level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to retrieve.

blocks.name: updateTeamVariable
blocks.description: Update a team level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to update.

args.name: secured
args.info: If true, this variable will be treated as secured. The value will never be exposed in the logs or the REST API.

args.name: key
args.info: The unique name of the variable

blocks.name: deleteTeamVariable
blocks.description: Delete a team level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to delete.

blocks.name: listTeamRepositories
blocks.description: All repositories owned by a user/team. This includes private repositories, but filtered down to the ones that the calling user has access to.

blocks.name: getCurrentUserInfo
blocks.description: Returns the currently logged in user.

blocks.name: listCurrentUserEmails
blocks.description: Returns all the authenticated user's email addresses. Both confirmed and unconfirmed.

blocks.name: getCurrentUserSingleEmail
blocks.description: Returns details about a specific one of the authenticated user's email addresses.

blocks.name: getUserInfo
blocks.description: Gets the public information associated with a user account.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user to retrieve

blocks.name: getUserFollowers
blocks.description: Returns the list of accounts that are following this user.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user to retrieve

blocks.name: getUserFollowing
blocks.description: Returns the list of accounts this user is following.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user to retrieve

blocks.name: listUserWebhooks
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of webhooks installed on this user.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user to retrieve

blocks.name: addUserWebhook
blocks.description: Install webhook on this user.

args.name: events
args.info: The events this webhook is subscribed to.

args.name: url
args.info: The URL events get delivered to.

args.name: description
args.info: A user-defined description of the webhook.

blocks.name: getUserSingleWebhook
blocks.description: Returns the webhook with the specified id installed on the given user account.

blocks.name: updateUserWebhook
blocks.description: Updates the webhook with the specified id installed on the given user account.

args.name: events
args.info: The events this webhook is subscribed to.

args.name: url
args.info: The URL events get delivered to.

args.name: description
args.info: A user-defined description of the webhook.

blocks.name: deleteUserWebhook
blocks.description: Deletes the webhook with the specified id installed on the given user account.

blocks.name: getUserSingleVariable
blocks.description: Retrieve a user level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to retrieve.

blocks.name: updateUserVariable
blocks.description: Update a user level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to update.

args.name: secured
args.info: If true, this variable will be treated as secured. The value will never be exposed in the logs or the REST API.

args.name: key
args.info: The unique name of the variable

blocks.name: deleteUserVariable
blocks.description: Deletes a user level variable.

args.name: variableId
args.info: The UUID of the variable to retrieve.

blocks.name: listUserRepositories
blocks.description: All repositories owned by a user. This includes private repositories, but filtered down to the ones that the calling user has access to.
